metadata.title: CVE-2020-13959 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The default error page for VelocityView in Apache Velocity Tools prior to3.1 reflects back the vm file that was entered as part of the URL. Anattacker can set an XSS payload file as this vm file in the URL whichresults in this payload being executed. XSS vulnerabilities allow attackersto execute arbitrary JavaScript in the context of the attacked website andthe attacked user. This can be abused to steal session cookies, performrequests in the name of the victim or for phishing attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvelocity-tools-java - 2.0-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: velocity-tools package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0-7ubuntu0.20.04.1').
